alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN HARRISON...NORTHEASTERN GUERNSEY...NORTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Farmerstown to near Freeport. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Freeport, Newcomerstown, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Bolivar, and Baltic. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 64 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
